info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Mecklenburg and east central York Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 556 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles south of Uptown Charlotte, or near Southpark Mall. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... South Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, East Charlotte, Matthews, Mint Hill, Fort Mill, Pineville, Freedom Park, The Arboretum and Carowinds. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
